name: Containerboard, average production, at mill, 2010
description:
Containerboard (linerboard and corrugating medium), average U.S. production, at mill. By-products were allocated 0% of the impacts to enable the user to choose and apply their own allocation method more easily.  All flows are production-weighted means. Data were developed for a full LCA that was critically reviewed. Reviewers were: Mr. Jamie Meil, Athena Institute - review panel Chairman; Ms. Lindita Bushi, Athena Institute; Ms Melissa Hamilton, Earthshift.

The unit process includes pulp production from wood and recovered paper, papermaking, and preparation for shipping to customers. Net purchased energy is included, but upstream flows associated with its generation are excluded. Flows associated with transportation of inputs from the technosphere are included.  Product transportation is excluded.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data was collected from participating companies and associations for their operational activities representative of 2010.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The survey included results from 46 containerboard mills representing 27 million short tons per year (TPY), nearly 78% of 2010 production volume.
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

exchanges.description: Proxy for total reduced sulfur compounds (TRS). TRS is a gaseous mixture of compounds consisting mainly of hydrogen sulfide (H2S), but it may also contain other gases such as methyl mercaptan (CH3S-H), dimethyl sulfide (CH3-S-CH3) and dimethyl disulfide (CH3-S-S-CH3). Reported as equivalent mass of H2S.
